diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Skin ulcers after rhinoplasty in a patient with Behçet disease
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient showed widespread small aphthous pustular lesions with central ulceration on the fourth postoperative day, consistent with the expected complications of Behçet disease, which are known to include mucocutaneous lesions such as oral and genital aphthous ulcers and skin lesions. The lesions regressed without scarring, indicating a non-complicated course.
